document.title: DYNAMIC LEARNING MAPS ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

5985113B9AF848038E25D0F49A518F39.description:
With guidance and support, use words acquired
through conversations, being read to, and during shared
reading activities.

149ABA051A62474690725FCE5C87F516.description:
With guidance and support, demonstrate understanding
of words by identifying real-life connections between
words and their use.Â

32470AEF94954E9C8A24100926ABEAC4.description:
With guidance and support, identify attributes of familiar
words.

EBA43A1AA9B44826B6C8A955E8355A7E.description:
With guidance and support, sort common objects into
familiar categories.

B8FA1DF2AB6141D28237BE07E7B29215.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of word
relationships.

EE941A382A8348E980DDF49C910EC9F5.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words used in every day
routines.

F6AB351F3B384AA092A8CDC30B649209.description:
Demonstrate emerging knowledge of word
meanings.

D7BD51F71A9B43ADB707D254C467000B.description:
With guidance and support during shared writing,
identify the letters that represent sounds needed to spell
words.

D4D9D38345374EE194D9F858A0CB6650.description: With guidance and support, use letters to create words.

608A579D08C44141BA8D937DAA068C2C.description:
With guidance and support during shared writing, put a
period at the end of a sentence.

CEEE4F8ABF6F4450AC72B366AC0161C0.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of
conventions of standard English.

EA16E6A611654C4C90106E60237F2F2E.description:
With guidance and support, use simple question words
(interrogatives) (e.g., who, what).

D96887A985DD46B5AE9C14ACEB1F317C.description:
With guidance and support, use common
prepositions(e.g., on, off, in, out).Â

40F6063DFF2D4D93B6DC1C1E20F37657.description:
With guidance and support, use familiar frequently
occurring adjectives (e.g., big, hot).

1DD2AFBC86A644E1B2AAA349717A598B.description:
With guidance and support, use familiar personal
pronouns (e.g., I, me, and you).

B3F46277356348A3BCA22FF70D29339D.description: Use frequently occurring plural nouns in communication.Â

E16683FBE98E4312BA5D6D27758727E9.description: Use frequently occurring nouns in communication.

9D139D2B6C914835B97F48349B89E77D.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of letter
and word use.Â

540E868620484251AF8CA94B8E57BAC0.description:
With guidance and support, provide more
information to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

D05CB514531443B8873A47A3D41EB6E1.description:
Add or select drawings or other visual or tactual
displays that relate to familiar people, places, things, and
events.

32A7C82218C24CF0B60CE29C47D9A116.description:
Identify familiar people, places, things, and
events.

6C1C616B8E29401BACDBCBCCAC8B86C6.description:
Communicate confusion or lack of
understanding ("I don't know.").

168A630491DD4940A72A92F9E066BD70.description:
During shared reading activities, answer
questions about details presented orally or through other media.

5C391209CF0E4AFE9A14C8933C0667FF.description:
Uses one or two words to ask questions related to
personally relevant topics.

3BED5460B146467CAE00AD682776F38D.description: Build on comments or topics initiated by an adult.

8ECA6CFCF0E34EBAB7FA1ED31FE3A88F.description:
Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with supportive
adults.

B50BBA4E37A4484998A205DA0E733037.description:
With guidance and support from adults,
identify information related to personal experiences and
answer simple questions about those experiences.

F7BBFCC616A14C3594587F2822F3DC7E.description:
With guidance and support, participate in
shared research and writing projects.

CC9CDFBAEEE540DFBBE6DE8DCE0DA40D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BCBDDB0D2229453AB85C8268E15E363A.description:
With guidance and support from adults,
explore a variety of digital tools to produce individual or
group writing.

4082897AE6A44AB2BA148123B4E8974B.description:
With guidance and support from adults,
add more information to own drawing, dictation, or
writing to strengthen it.

68CC2457EC624D08957E22E564931A7A.description:
Select an event and use drawing,
dictating, or writing to share information about it.

785C2B32BF2042FE8E51D1C5C6B899FC.description:
Select a familiar topic and use drawing,
dictating, or writing to share information about it.

696ADF5985364B42805E6B1D4B31CBB0.description:
Select a familiar book and use drawing,
dictating, or writing to state an opinion about it.Â

4E058617BA0341F99D5AC1A146DDF8D0.description:
Participate in shared reading of a variety of reading
materials reflecting a variety of text genre.Â

55AA7791BB5C40C797D74C51547A12ED.description: Engage in sustained, independent study of books.

EFE8557E5B1047648EBE6E6A6F68A56F.description: Begin to attend to words in print.

47281344BB294833A4115603C4796EC9.description:
With guidance and support, recognize familiar words
that are used in every day routines.

DAF0D085502943B0BA79440A4FE15BC6.description: Identify upper case letters of the alphabet.

6082F4C00A30497B8FEEC4F5CEC9639D.description:
Demonstrate emerging letter and word
identification skills.

5F114195E3CB4CEDB8142A3F187776D8.description:
With guidance and support, substitute individual sounds
(phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new
words.

8EEFFFABA0B3479EACA0E592CA70E301.description:
Identify a single syllable spoken word with the same
onset (beginning sound) as a familiar word.

E3B300CA48CB4203845687D9CB30C3A5.description:
With guidance and support, match orally presented
segmented phonemes (e.g., C-A-T) to pictures or words
illustrating the corresponding word.

665ED3C4BF7C4E3BA6482390B8E033E2.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words,
syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

C3EF76C9132F45DF9D206A122226E427.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and
basic features of print (e.g., left-to-right, top-to-bottom
orientation of print, one-to-one correspondence between
written and spoken word).Â

3857016F86034E4FBF4B0C26437FCF5C.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of the
organization of print.

DC4A18CF13EA47DEA467F39B960FAAC1.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of
informational text.

C1C3FBCE9BA84C04ABDEB5C8B7ED43BA.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

10F91CDD09784A40A8EE003A70B59C52.description:
With guidance and support, match similar parts
of two texts on the same topic.

B200B9C361FC417C8C42C9EC0EC04AA4.description:
Identify points the author makes in a familiar
informational text.

0622212B9F214E9F904C7EC372E0F390.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information
that go with a familiar text.

8FE386EC64644EAA81D1891C75E0940F.description:
Distinguish between words and illustrations in a
text.

DE988915BF574D8AB0BAA86C16DE31A7.description:
Locate the front cover, back cover, and title page
of a book.Â

AB90ECE35F2B43258C306567F31B3F8B.description:
With guidance and support, ask a reader to
clarify the meaning of a word in a text.

9C321B7AF9CB46BF9B2369FA404E5FDE.description:
Identify individuals, events, or details in a
familiar informational text.

1007EF7A9D8B4AF7B40D7EBB6C8B41D1.description:
With guidance and support, identify details
related to the topic of a text.

85530CF92EF040CEA7DE7F2581DF664E.description:
With guidance and support, actively engage in
shared reading for a clearly stated purpose.

16AD69DD897B4D69A0792926BB98FD82.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3DA304AD286042A9AD802D23F5B9463E.description:
With guidance and support identify adventures
or experiences of characters in a story as same or different.

277D05FF11864500915DC75340033115.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual
information that go with a familiar story.

4D9F0C8A6BF640AFBBE4EBF19265CDB0.description:
With guidance and support, identify a speaker
within a familiar story.Â Â

17459ADEAC134E1C9227E765B52BC709.description:
With guidance and support, identify a text as
telling a story.Â

6A2C7DFD300C439F8C02B3A097E50C21.description:
With guidance and support, identify sensory or
feeling words in a familiar story.

815EFCEDFD044823B2FE24F2DCBF4F21.description:
Â Identify characters and settings in a familiar
story.

36A0318B9E984C269E5DB8BCF6E8C448.description:
With guidance and support, recount major
events in familiar stories.Â Â
